page.title: 07FARMING IN CURY/GUNWALLOE.
page.content: Most farms in the area are mainly dairy farms.Some farms have beef cattle as well.Crops are also grown on the farms, There are various crops such as: Barley, wheat, cabbage, brocolli, carrots, potatoes and mangles, the latter for winter feed Many farmers in the area have cultivated grassland which costs 33 pounds per acre for seeds. Most farms use tractors or ploughs. The average number of acres is about 74 acres . Farmers rotate their crops every year and have about four fields of crops and most fields are just left for grazing. Some farms do not only have cattle and crops but also have other animals such as: Sheep, horses, dogs, cats, pigs and goats. They also have chickens.
